project.name: Audio Streaming Update
project.notes:
Audio Streaming:

– On the back-end Content Management System for the apps (which you manage), we’ll add the ability for UVA to add streams (by providing URL/address) for given games, and add a start and end time for each. – On the current UVA iPhone and Android Apps: – In the Athletics section we’ll add a “Live Audio” with live streams – In the Athletics section we’ll add a “Live Audio” that shows up on the details page of each game that is set up in the CMS with a Live Audio – Add a link to the Live Audio section in the “Sports Radio” section of the apps – Assumptions:
1) The streams can be provided in MP3 format compatible with both iOS and Android, specifically:

For iOS: MP3 (MPEG-1 Audio Layer 3) 8 kHz to 48 kHz, stereo audio Android: MP3 Mono/Stereo 8-320Kbps constant (CBR) or variable bit-rate (VBR)
2) Hosting/streaming provider is responsible for ensuring sufficient bandwidth
3) No pay wall – Cost: Capped at $2,000 per app platform (e.g. iOS) for Design, Development, Testing and Launch, so $4,000 total for both iOS and Android

project.name: AdHoc Bug Fixes - CLP Reset
project.notes:
--------
Added by: Blake Sirach
10/22/14: Received email approval from Elizabeth Lobato for:
10 Android Hours
15 Web Hours
8 PM Hours
Total Cost: $5,500
-------


Process for this bucket of billable hours: 

1. Issue is logged during regression. 

2. Clearleap and WT Representatives triage on a daily basis during regression. 

3. At end of the regression, all issues that are critical or blocker should be fixed. Clearleap (Alex+Tom) has final call on what should or shouldn't be fixed.  

4. Blake delivers list of issues/descriptions with rough estimates to Bizdev. 

5. Bizdev sends to HBON for approval. HBO Approves. 

6. HBO Approves, we begin fixing for builds to be deployed prior to next regression.
